titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the John Thomas McGill Papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

repository.corpname: Special Collections Manuscripts and Rare Books

did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of John Thomas McGill (1851-1946), longtime faculty member and Dean of the School of Pharmacy at Vanderbilt. He also served as Secretary and Treasurer of the Tennessee Academy of Science for 15 years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the papers of John Thomas McGill (1851-1946), longtime faculty member and Dean of the School of Pharmacy at Vanderbilt. He also served as Secretary and Treasurer of the Tennessee Academy of Science for 15 years.
The Increasing Responsibilities of the Pharmacist
The Qualifications for Licensure Required by Law Determine the Standard of Pharmaceutical Education
The Relation of the American Conference of Pharmaceutical Faculties to the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy with Reference to the Educational Prerequisite for the Practice of Pharmacy
What Degrees Should Be Conferred by Schools of Pharmacy?
High Schools in the Southern States
The New York State and Boston Proposition with Respect to Degrees
A Resolution in Regard to Pharmaceutical Degrees - 6 copies
What Degrees Should be Conferred by Schools of Pharmacy? - 4 copies

One-page partial report by McGill; two pages from Tennessee Pharmaceutical Association; Hendrix College Bulletin, 1916; lists of names; material in German; minutes of Summer School Faculty Meeting, March 4, 1901; Dept. of Pharmacy Graduation Certificate; Excursion Announcement; Holograph report of School of Pharmacy, 1917-1918; Information of U. S. High Schools. Questionnaire; Final Exam, Pharmacy 1916. poem.

chronitem.event: Born in Monroe County, Tennessee
Principal of Bentonville High School
B. S., Vanderbilt University
President, Vanderbilt Alumni Association
Secretary, Dept. of Pharmacy
PhD., Vanderbilt Uiversity and member of faculty
PhG degree, Vanderbilt University
Historian of Vanderbilt Alumni Association
Year of study at University of Berlin, Germany
President of Vanderbilt Alumni Fund Committee
Chairman, Alumni Association Executive Committee which organized the Alumni Fund
Married Lizzie Allen of Harrisonville, Missouri
Full Professor
Phi Beta Kappa - Secretary, Vanderbilt Chapter. Continued in this office until his death.
Retired as Emeritus Professor of Organic Chemistry
Secretary and treasurer of Tennessee Academy of Science
Tennessee Academy of Science names biological building at Reelfoot Lake after McGill. Establishment of this station in 1931 was a·result of McGill’s efforts.
Retirement as secretary-treasurer of Tennessee Academy of Science; elected honorary president of life.
Published The Vanderbilt Chapter of Phi Beta Kappa, 1901-1943
Died at home on Vanderbilt campus
Dean of School of Pharmacy for fifteen years, Member of IV Club, Old Oak Club.

did.unittitle: Correspondence - Outgoing. Chronologically arranged. Undated placed last.
Letters Concerning extraneous matters. Topics include inquiries about entrance requirements into school of pharmacy, requests for information, etc. Arranged alphabetically by sender.
Holograph Notes - Notes by McGill and others on various topics. The name “Joy Crunn11 is signed on one sheet.
Reports on Ducktown Sulphur Copper and Iron Co. Concerns air pollution. Charts and analyses, legal documents, business receipts, reports, newspaper clippings.
Circulars - form letters and cards - incoming and outgoing.
Garland Memorial - planning and fund raising material, invoices, contract between Alumni Association and sculptor.
Summer School - Receipts and Business Papers.
Records and Facts of University History.
Faculty - Holograph lists of faculty members.
Faculty of Law Dept. and Biblical Dept.
Faculty of Academic Dept. - Biographical Information.
Lists of Faculty and Students - Dept. of Pharmacy and Dentistry.
Class Lists - Engineering, Academic, Biblical, Dental Dept. and graduate students.
Alumni - Academic Dept. - notes up to 1891.
Alumni Assoc. - lists of alumni speakers, minutes of meetings, recrods of dues paid.
Pamphlets - Alumni Association - Alumni Address, Constitution and By-Laws, Executive Committee Reports.
Barnard Club. Information such as mailing lists, financial record, newspaper clipping, lectures.
Applications - recognition and accrediting of Pharmacy Schools.
Articles by McGill - typescript and printed. Alphabetically arranged.
Information about McGill. pages from The Bulletin of Pharmacy and from American Druggist and Pharmaceutical Record, The Pharmaceutical Era and one page of typescript.
Miscellaneous - see other page for description.
Pamphlets - M.E. Church and Vanderbilt - 5 items.
Articles by Others - “Pharmaceutical Education” by Otto A. Wall.

Papers by Others Frank Butenshon, “Action of Light on Chanicals and Pharmaceuticals”; Charles Cason, “Alumni Trustees in American Universities Methods of Obtaining Expression of Alumni Opinion and Wishes in the Selection of Trustees - Postal Ballot”; W. H. Witt “The Bishops and the Carnegie Gift.” parti’(al article “The Development of Civic Improvement in Tennessee”

list.item: R. F. Chew “The Ends We Aim At”
E. I. Crockett “Schiller’s ‘Lay of the Bell’” - 2 copies.
Duncan U. Fletcher, “What Will He Do With It?”
Percy W. Gardner “The Agencies of Our National Progress”
G. C. Jones “The Impress of Thought” - 2 copies.
A. V. Lane “Note on a Roulette”
Henry N. Snyder “Vanderbilt University in Some of Its Relations to Higher Education at the South”

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Pamphlets - The Student World, Vol. 1, No.3, March 1884.
Printed Books - Material dealing with Pharmaceutical Association meetings. Commercial Press, Ltd., a handbook.
Printed Books: A. V. Lane, Adjustments of the Compass, Transit, and Level; J. T. McGill, Laboratory Experiments in General Chemistry; Emil Otto, German Reader.
Entire box contains programs, announcements, and invitations.
Announcements and Invitations - Vanderbilt Moot Court
Box contains newspaper and magazine clippings. Clippings are arranged by topic alphabetically.

note.p: Several articles are often pasted on one page. The term item indicates each separate page of articles. If an article is carried over on more than one page, then these pages are considered one item.

Glenn, Dr. L. C. (geology professor, iris-grower)

Haden, Mrs. T. H. (Jennie Conwell - Methodist missionary)
Hall, Fitzgerald- 4 items (president, N.C. & St. L.; law professor; Board of Trust)
Hambleton, Dr. B. F. (medical professor; acting medical dean)
Hart, Henry G. (S. C. A. secretary)
Hendrix, E.R. - 3 items (bishop, presieent of Board of Trust)
Hospital, Vanderbilt - First Board of Managers
Hume, Alfred - 3 items (math professor, president, University of Mississippi)
Yun, T. H. (Yun Chi Ho) - 2 items
Thomas H. McAdams, W. G. McAdams
Dept. of Agriculture, Bureau of Chemistry
Mr. and Mrs. Frances P. Garvan

index.head: Index to Incoming Correspondence
index.p: (Addressee, unless otherwise noted, is John Thomas McGill.)
